title: [BUG] `Imputer` does not transform on unseen instances
body:
Summary by @fkiraly: `Imputer` does not `transform` on unseen instances, which it probably should because it does not need to `fit`. This shoudl be investigated as a potential bug. ### Discussed in https://github.com/sktime/sktime/discussions/3574
Originally posted by **kylehiroyasu** October 12, 2022 Hi I am just getting started with `sktime` and I have data where some instances are missing measurements at certain time intervals. I expected that I could just using the `Imputer` to interpolate intermediate values as part of a pipeline. However I get an error when the `Imputer.transform` is called on data size data other than the training data: ```python import numpy as np from sktime.transformations.series.impute import Imputer transformer = Imputer() train = np.random.uniform(size=(3,10,20)) test = np.random.uniform(size=(5,10,20)) test[2,:,5] = np.nan transformer.fit(train) transformer.transform(test) ``` ``` --------------------------------------------------------------------------- RuntimeError Traceback (most recent call last) Cell In [1], line 10 7 test[2,:,5] = np.nan 9 transformer.fit(train) ---> 10 transformer.transform(test) File ~/miniconda3/envs/egg_project/lib/python3.9/site-packages/sktime/transformations/base.py:390, in BaseTransformer.transform(self, X, y) 387 Xt = self._transform(X=X_inner, y=y_inner) 388 else: 389 # otherwise we call the vectorized version of predict --> 390 Xt = self._vectorize("transform", X=X_inner, y=y_inner) 392 # convert to output mtype 393 X_out = self._convert_output(Xt, metadata=metadata) File ~/miniconda3/envs/egg_project/lib/python3.9/site-packages/sktime/transformations/base.py:930, in BaseTransformer._vectorize(self, methodname, **kwargs) 927 n_fit = len(self.transformers_.index) 929 if n != n_fit: --> 930 raise RuntimeError( 931 "found different number of instances in transform than in fit. " 932 f"number of instances seen in fit: {n_fit}; " 933 f"number of instances seen in transform: {n}" 934 ) 936 # transform the i-th series/panel with the i-th stored transformer 937 Xts = [] RuntimeError: found different number of instances in transform than in fit. number of instances seen in fit: 3; number of instances seen in transform: 5 ``` Is this the expected behavior? and if so what is the reasoning? Thanks in advance :)
